Name: Stela of Nes-hor
Description: The face of this stela is divided into three sections by incised lines. In the lunette are nefer-signs and two jackals with captions. The offering scene in the second register is simple. The owner of the stela Nes-hor is standing in adoration before the falcon-headed god Re. Between them is a massive offering table with a water jar and a bouquet of flowers on it. Underneath are three lines of text, giving the names of relatives of Nes-hor. The stela is of rather poor quality.
